pros: Lovely staff and great pay working from home

pros: Flexy working Option to WFH
cons: Less pay then NHS Give impression of friendly supportive management but if you need help when it matter turn their back on you Awful team unit management out for themselves- all about amount of calls not for the women

pros: Good training for the role and was good location. Secure parking and free parking when I worked there. Don't have to take work home with you, lots of support from staff around if you did have any problems.
cons: Can be stressful on the phones. Very little flexibility to allow working from home.

review_title: Rapid changes make it difficult to keep pace
pros: Family friendly Approachable Supportive Friendly Flexible
cons: Micro management Lack of admin time Constant changes Weekend work Bank holidays work

pros: The chance to show compassion and kindness to people who needed help.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Coventry, England
pros:
Whilst it is a medium sized organisation the feeling is definitely of a close-knit team; all working together for the benefit and safety of young women in particular.
Roles are well-defined without too much overlap so everyone knows they are valued - good experienced staff are extremely difficult to replace.
cons: There are none, although the majority of the staff are female - some may see that are a con.

pros: Great people, collaborative, exciting and worthwhile cause
cons: The salary is too low

pros:
Nice recruitment process 
Early finish Fridays (supposedly lol)
cons:
Extremely poor new starter experience - no training, no induction, waiting weeks for a phone and laptop, line managers have no experience or skills or training in how to manage or give good/bad feedback, structure of work and who does what is poor, tasks haphazardly given out at random and not as per job description 
The culture is bad from top to bottom - avoid at all costs

pros: - rewarding job when it comes to actually helping people in need.
cons:
- management is rude and power happy.
- no flexibility in hours.
- expected to take on more work regularly, specifically with high staff turnover.
-no real opportunity to develop or move up, training opportunities are regularly cancelled.

review_title: Don’t bother if you want to be valued or supported by management
pros: Providing women with an empathetic non judgemental service
cons: Really bad employers, substandard training, poor management, no support or loyalty

pros: Good place to work,often busy and challenging.
cons: Bad head management.They do not care about lower staff.

pros: great charity to work at

pros: Free drinks, parking and (that's it!)
cons: Poor training, very unprofessional staff in BIC at Stratford-upon-Avon.  Deliberately intimidating new starters by backstabbing and negative feedback from managers.  Very inflexible - won't change hours once assigned to shifts.  Salary is very poor and takes years to climb to decent salary (if your face fits).

pros: Some AMAZING colleagues, good support from colleagues within the unit.
cons: Too many to list! NO communication, Negative Middle management who use ‘bully’ techniques, NO breaks, expected to work beyond contracted hours, only care about statistics and not about the women!
